page.title: 17Farming in Low Lorton
page.content: On the outskirts of the Lake DISTRICT the farms have a mixture of level, low lying ground with a varying proportion of hill/fell land. The farms carry mixed livestock dairy or beef cattle with sheep. The land is used for either grazing or the production of sileage and hay for winter feed. 5 of the farms have dairy herds, 2 with 20 cows, 3 with 70/80 cows. They all carry a small flock of ewes up to 70. 7 farms concentrate on the production of beef. The largest carries a suckler herd of 140 cows and calves, plus about 1000 fell sheep. The final 2 farms rent out a sizeable proportion of their land for summer grazing. The average size of farm is about 200 acres, ranging from 54 acres at High Stanger to 600 acres at Terrace Farm.
